bioghist.p: Swarthmore College's Faculty Committee on the Pre-Medical Program was established in 1949 by President John Nason to provide guidance to pre-medical undergraduate students at Swarthmore and to prepare comprehensive letters of recommendation for those students. The committee also compiled academic statistics on the pre-medical students and tracked their progress in medical school.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records of the Faculty Committee on the Pre-Medical Program from 1943-1959. Materials include: committee reports; letters of recommendation; faculty evaluations of students; statistical summaries of Swarthmore students' grades and their progress in medical schools; surveys of medical students; correspondence with students and faculty of various medical schools; and multiple copies of a 1959 guide for pre-medical students at Swarthmore.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
